headline.main: After Initial Trump Trade, Politics Keep Stocks on Edge
headline.print_headline: After Initial Trump Trade, Politics Keep Stocks on Edge

docs.snippet: Arguing over politics is a Thanksgiving Day tradition, but Donald Trump's presidential election adds a new twist to any bickering at next week's holiday dinner table: What the new U.S. government could mean for your stock portfolio....
docs.lead_paragraph: Arguing over politics is a Thanksgiving Day tradition, but Donald Trump's presidential election adds a new twist to any bickering at next week's holiday dinner table: What the new U.S. government could mean for your stock portfolio.

headline.main: UN Agency Lifts Zika Emergency, Prepares for Long-Term Fight
headline.print_headline: UN Agency Lifts Zika Emergency, Prepares for Long-Term Fight

docs.snippet: Acknowledging Zika is "here to stay," the United Nations health agency on Friday lifted a 9-month-old emergency declaration and prepared for a longer-term response to the mosquito-borne virus that can result in severe neurological defects in newbo...
docs.lead_paragraph: Acknowledging Zika is "here to stay," the United Nations health agency on Friday lifted a 9-month-old emergency declaration and prepared for a longer-term response to the mosquito-borne virus that can result in severe neurological defects in newborns whose mothers were infected.

headline.main: Who First Farmed Potatoes? Archaeologists in Andes Find Evidence
headline.print_headline: Historic Roots: An American Staple, Thanks to Peru

docs.snippet: Archaeologists have found ancient starch grains pinpointing the Titicaca Basin of southern Peru as a hearth of early potato cultivation....
docs.abstract: Scientists find 'microremains' of what appear to be potatoes on ancient culinary tools at Jiskairumoko, archeological site in Peru dating to 3400 BC; potatoes, originally domesticated in South America, would not have been present in North America for first Thanksgiving feast.

keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Archaeologists have found ancient starch grains pinpointing the Titicaca Basin of southern Peru as a hearth of early potato cultivation.

headline.main: Developer Says Dakota Access Pipeline Will Not Be Rerouted: AP

docs.snippet: Energy Transfer Partners LP Chief Executive Officer Kelcy Warren said the company will not consider rerouting its Dakota Access oil pipeline despite concerns voiced by U.S. native groups, according to an Associated Press interview published on Fri...
docs.lead_paragraph: Energy Transfer Partners LP Chief Executive Officer Kelcy Warren said the company will not consider rerouting its Dakota Access oil pipeline despite concerns voiced by U.S. native groups, according to an Associated Press interview published on Friday.

headline.main: The Images in ‘Billy Lynn’? Razor Sharp. Your Eyes? Bewildered.

docs.snippet: Ang Lee shot his new movie at 120 frames per second, far faster than the typical 24. It is uncommonly clear. But maybe viewers prefer softer textures....

headline.main: Alaska Air Nearing Settlement With U.S. on Virgin Deal-Source
headline.print_headline: Alaska Air Nearing Settlement With U.S. on Virgin Deal-Source

docs.snippet: Alaska Air Group Inc is close to reaching a settlement with U.S. antitrust officials that will allow it to complete its proposed $2.6 billion acquisition of Virgin America Inc, according to a person familiar with the matter....
docs.lead_paragraph: Alaska Air Group Inc is close to reaching a settlement with U.S. antitrust officials that will allow it to complete its proposed $2.6 billion acquisition of Virgin America Inc, according to a person familiar with the matter.
